It was previously known as Taitapu. It is located 6 kilometres east of Lincoln and 18 kilometres south west of Christchurch. It has a school, church and hotel that was established in 1856. The name Tai Tapu is derived from the Maori words "wai tapu". This means water. ==References== Category:Settlements in Canterbury Region Category:Banks Peninsula Category:Selwyn District
